p: Interventions with the participation of local entities like local governments, traditional and cultural leaders should be designed to target these structural drivers. Studies need to be done to rigorously test feasible and promising interventions such as one to keep adolescent girls in school in India [ 36], Safe Homes and Respect for Everyone (SHARE) project in Uganda, a intervention against domestic violence which has shown a reduction in physical and sexual intimate partner violence and a corresponding reduction in HIV incidence [ 37, 38]. Another such project, SASA!, also in Uganda showed community level interventions can result in reduction of intimate partner violence, high risk sexual behaviors and strengthening community based structures to enhance these changes [ 39â€“ 41].
